doc.after: In Classical Antiquity the inquiry into the workings of the universe took place both in investigations aimed at such practical goals as establishing a reliable calendar or determining how to cure a variety of illnesses and in those abstract investigations known as natural philosophy The ancient people who are considered the first scientists may have thought of themselves as natural philosophers as practitioners of a skilled profession for example physicians or as followers of a religious tradition for example temple healers
